meanings.sent1: The play was very nondramatic, with no exciting scenes or intense emotions.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was nondramatic, simply stating the facts without any flair.
meanings.sent3: The cat's reaction to the vacuum cleaner was quite nondramatic, just a casual glance before going back to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The pond was nondramatic, its surface as still as a painting.
meanings.sent5: The nondramatic sunset painted the sky in soft pastel colors, lacking the usual fiery drama.

meanings.definition: Not involving or relating to drama.
meanings.sent1: The meeting was nondramatic, focusing solely on budget numbers and project timelines.
meanings.sent2: His job was nondramatic, dealing with paperwork and emails rather than stage performances.
meanings.sent3: The nondramatic conversation about the weather quickly turned into a debate about the best ice cream flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her nondramatic life resembled a quiet stream, flowing steadily without sudden twists or turns.
meanings.sent5: The nondramatic documentary explored the daily lives of ants, showcasing their routine existence without any added drama.

meanings.sent1: The movie was nondramatic, following a simple storyline without any unexpected plot twists.
meanings.sent2: His expression remained nondramatic, showing no hint of surprise or excitement.
meanings.sent3: The nondramatic cake tasted plain, lacking any special flavors or decorations.
meanings.sent4: The nondramatic landscape stretched endlessly, devoid of any striking features.
meanings.sent5: The nondramatic performance received polite applause, lacking the usual cheers and standing ovations.
